result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric Donald Gryczkowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Two days jail credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
No consumption or possession of alcohol. No entry into any bars or taverns.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.
Must undergo and successfully complete an anger management assessment.

timeConds.notes: To be completed within the first 6 months of probation.

Concurrent with: Count #1

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric Donald Gryczkowski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Revoked - Sentenced to Jail
Does not plan to seek.

Defendant Eric Donald Gryczkowski in court with attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  Defendant Eric Donald Gryczkowski in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the Forest, County of. Called at 10:25 AM. Called 16CM26, 17CM168 and 17CM54. Court has plea questionnaire handed to him on 17CM68. State - 17CM168 - resolved - have complied with victim notification requirements with no response of VIS but she is in the Coutoom - defendant would plead G or NC to counts #1, #4 and #5 as alelged, counts #2 and #3 - DRI, joint recommendation is 120 days in FC jail on each count - concurrent to each other, court costs on each count. Gryczkowski and Svehlek agree. Court dismisses and reads in counts #2 and #3. Gryczkowski pleads NC to counts #1, #4 and #5 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - this will run in tandem with the SEHR on two other cases - recommends 120 days on each count - concurrent to each other. Svehlek makes final argument prior to sentencing - agrees with the joint recommendation of 120 days jail on each count, concurrent to each other. Gryczkowski makes statement, remorseful. Victim makes brief statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1, #4 and #5 - 120 days in FC jail - concurrent to each other - huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - credit for 44 days, costs on each count - 60 DTP from release of custody/CO, submit DNA sample, right to appeal. 17CM54 and 17CM26 - both cases are here for SEHR, all parties have revocation paperwork. Svehlek states there are no errors or misstatements. State - no errors or ommissions - notes that the 44 days that was just previously ordered is in play if these cases are ran concurrent, State will be asking for consecutive time, State comes up with 33 days credit on 17CM54 and 52 days on 16CM26 plus possibly an additional 44 days on each case if matters are run concurrent. State makes final argument prior to recommendations - on 16CM26 - recommends 90 days - consecutive to 17CM168 with credit for 54 days, on 17CM54 - recommends 3 months on count #1 and 8 months on count #2 - concurrent to each other but consecutive to 16CM26. Svehlek makes argument prior to recommendation but asks for clarification on 17CM54. State clarifies. Svehlek continues her sentencing argument - recommends 9 months in FC jail total on all cases being revoked and concurrent to each other and to 17CM168 as well. Gryczkowski makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: on 16CM26  #1 - 6 months in FC jail, #2 - 6 months in FC jail - concurrent to count #1 but consecutive to jail on 17CM168; on 17CM54 - count #1 - 90 days in FC jail, #2 - 6 months in FC jail - concurrent to each other and concurrent to jail on 16CM26 but consecutive to jail on 17CM168, all sentences get huber and good time post adjudication, 16CM26 - 52 days credit, 17CM54 - 33 days credit, turn any unpaid fines into civil judgments, right to appeal, adjourned.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 1, 2017 at 10:15 am.
for Unpaid Court Obligations - Extended for 12 months

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Modification to Conditions of Probation - 30 days in FC jail without huber - faxed to jail and P&P

Defendant Eric Donald Gryczkowski in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the Forest, County of. Called at 10:57 AM. State - believes we are here at request of P&P. Ashley Drexler appears for P&P. Drexler asks Court for direction on supervision, defendant is due to be released from probation but has not completed several components of his conditions, makes a record in regards to the violations/issues. Attorney Lynch now appears with the defendant, states the defendant is willing to extend probation to get those issues completed but lack of funding/means to follow up with some of the conditions. Court extends probation for 1 year but warns defendant of additional conditions that it could compose if these conditions do not get completed. Gryczkowski understands, has nothing to say, no objections to extending probation. Drexler makes additional comments. Court orders the defendant to contact the providers and make appointment(s) for AODA aftercare within the next 15 days and all P&P requirements to be completed in 120 days or will face additional sanctions. Gryczkowski understands.
Review hearing on March 15, 2017 at 10:30 am.
From DOC requesting hearing date.

Does not plan to seek.

Defendant Eric Donald Gryczkowski in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:05 PM. State resolution - Count 3 - amend to FC ordinance of DC - $300 fine plus costs. Counts 1 & 2 - defendant would plead guilty to both counts - 12 months probation, costs only, AODA with follow through, anger management, has complied with victim notification and no restitution has been submitted, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol, no entry into bars or taverns, FT employment, 50 hours of community service. Scholke and Gryczkowski agree. Court amends count 3 to FC ordinance of DC, defendant pleads G, court accepts plea and imposes fine of $300 plus costs, 60 DTP/CO. Defendant pleads G to counts 1 & 2.  Court goes over PLQ with defendant and finds he is freely, voluntarily and intelligently entering his plea, waiving his constitutional rights and right to jury trial, court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges guilty. State make final statement and asks court to follow joint recommendation. Scholke makes final statement and asks court to follow joint recommendation. Gryczkowski makes statement, remorseful. Court accepts joint recommendation sentences the defendant to the following: Counts 1 & 2 - With hold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conditions: costs only on each count, AODA and follow through with any recommendations, anger management assessment and successfully complete, no consumption or possession of alcohol, no entry into any bars or taverns, FT employment, 50 hours of community service to be completed within first 6 months of probation. Must not possess a firearm. DNA sample required with expungement rights given on the DNA sample. 2 days jail credit if revoked.
